I'd be happy to help you with that. Here are some examples of APA-style in-text citations and reference list entries for different types of sources:

**Books**

* In-text citation: (Smith, 2020)
* Reference list entry:
Smith, J. (2020). The impact of climate change on mental health. New York, NY: Routledge.

**Book Chapters**

* In-text citation: (Johnson, 2019, p. 23)
* Reference list entry:
Johnson, K. (2019). The effects of climate change on anxiety. In J. Smith (Ed.), Climate change and mental health (pp. 23-45). New York, NY: Routledge.

**Journal Articles**

* In-text citation: (Lee et al., 2022, p. 12)
* Reference list entry:
Lee, J., Kim, S., & Park, J. (2022). The relationship between climate change and depression. Journal of Environmental Psychology, 76(3), 345-356. doi: 10.1016/j.jenvp.2022.01.003

**Websites**

* In-text citation: (National Institute of Mental Health, 2022)
* Reference list entry:
National Institute of Mental Health. (2022). Climate change and mental health. Retrieved from <https://www.nimh.nih.gov/health/topics/climate-change-and-mental-health/index.shtml>

**Online News Articles**

* In-text citation: (Harris, 2022)
* Reference list entry:
Harris, S. (2022, February 10). Climate change linked to increased anxiety in young people. The New York Times. Retrieved from <https://www.nytimes.com/2022/02/10/climate/anxiety-climate-change.html>

**Conference Proceedings**

* In-text citation: (Williams et al., 2020, p. 12)
* Reference list entry:
Williams, J., Brown, K., & Davis, J. (2020). The impact of climate change on mental health in rural communities. Proceedings of the 2020 International Conference on Climate Change and Mental Health, 12-20. doi: 10.1016/j.procedia.2020.02.003

**Thesis or Dissertation**

* In-text citation: (Hall, 2019)
* Reference list entry:
Hall, J. (2019). The effects of climate change on mental health in urban areas (Doctoral dissertation). University of California, Los Angeles.

**Government Reports**

* In-text citation: (U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, 2020, p. 5)
* Reference list entry:
U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. (2020). Climate change and mental health: A review of the literature. Retrieved from <https://www.epa.gov/climate-change/climate-change-mental-health>

Remember to always check the APA Publication Manual (7th ed.) or the APA Style website for the most up-to-date guidance on formatting and styling your references.
